entry.et: Middle English quaile, from Anglo-French, from Medieval Latin quaccula, of imitative origin

def.dt: :any of numerous small gallinaceous birds: as
:an Old World migratory game bird (Coturnix coturnix)

entry.et: Middle English, from Middle Dutch quelen

def.dt: :to give way :falter his courage never quailed
:to recoil in dread or terror :cower the strongest quail before financial ruin Samuel Butler †1902
:any of a family (Turnicidae) of small terrestrial Old World birds that resemble quails and have only three toes on a foot with the hind toe being absent
:a quail (Coturnix japonica syn. C. coturnix japonica) of eastern Asia that is sometimes raised for its meat or eggs and is used in laboratory research
